Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2009 09:35AM - edited Oct 13, 2009 08:56AM by renee1008 I'm sorry your mom and your family have to go thru this, but like she said not only is it treatable, it is curable.  I was dx last Oct.  I was 47 and have a 20 year old daughter.  My onc told me that 10 years younger than I was at dx is when my daughter should start mammos.  So, at 37, she will have her first.  The hardest part for me was telling people, so I know how she feels.  I didn't want to be anything less to anyone.  I pretty much kept up my normal routine.  I only missed work the day of treatments.  I had a lumpectomy, chemo and radiation.  Chemo was my choice, for peace of mind.  I was right in the middle of the chart as far as recurrence.  So, for 4 treatments, that now days are not so bad, it was well worth it.  Talk all you need to, ask any question you can think of.  Your mom sounds like she has a good attitude.  She needs to keep it up, and everyone around her.  Waiting is so hard.  I'm sure she is very anxious.  When she meets with onc and gets a plan, she will be better.  I'll pray for you and your family.  That's the main thing that go me thru my ordeal, and helps me still, every day.\ --Renee

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2010 04:01PM renee1008 wrote: Hello Ladies, I don't post often but keep up with you (or try to...) and take in all the unspoken advise.  I was a natural blonde with fairly straight hair (a little wave).  It came back dark brown and very, very curly.  My hair has always grown very slowly.  I didn't start taking Biotin until after going topless (wore a wig for 7 months) I just recently had my first hair cut (I cut all the kinky curls off) and am really liking the short cut.  I always wore it shoulder length before.  Since I like the short style I'm thinking about not taking biotin any longer.  Does it just grow length or does it make it thicker?  If it will thicken up I want to continue taking it, but if it just grows the existing hair longer, I don't know.  I can't believe after all the waiting for hair, that I'm even concerned about it growing longer...

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2009 03:52PM renee1008 wrote: Hello all. My oncotype score was right in the middle of the chart....24. One # either way and my onc would have said either yes or no.  I went into her office as scared of the word "chemo" as I was "cancer". I was so hoping she wouldn't recommend chemo, but before I left her office I was afraid she wouldn't let me do chemo.  I say fight it with all you've got.  I can say I did everything I could do, and for me, peace of mind, was well worth it.  I did 4 x taxotere and cytoxan.  No nausea.  I, too, could have slept thru treatments if it weren't for the nice people there to talk to during them.  I'm 22 weeks out from chemo and 14 from radiation.  My hair's coming in...black and curly...and I'm naturally blonde with straight hair.  I'm begining to feel like "me" again.  Praying for you all.
